reviews.review_msg: Paul is a great teacher! He is willing to put in the work if you are. He will provide you feedback on your essays and builds an atmosphere to promote teaching opposed to the standard "getting through the curriculum" many teachers offer.  English was never my strong suit, but Paul made me feel confident to continue writing. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

After taking this course, I became a huge fan of him. His lectures may come off as radical at times but his ideas are very inspirational and thought-provoking. And you can literally see he's really passionate about teaching and don't be afraid to take advantage of his office hours. He's very accommodating and provides in-depth feedback.

Paul is eclectic. His passion for the topic is clear. For students however, the material is difficult and complicated to process, let alone write about. Little room for personal interpretation considering it's his lectures, reading his textbook. Very helpful nonetheless. TA's are not willing to mark easier, but still use them for guidance.

Paul is a very boring teacher. His lectures are as interesting as eating a whole dry stale hamburger bun. Not only does he not talk about the course material in lectures he does not seem to know the material for the Pros Genres class. Would not take again.

His lectures are very off topic and communicate little to no information that is of any relevance to the course. If you enjoy a prof who rambles, reads directly from the book, and has troubles organizing the entire lecture than you've chosen the right course.
